nodes.text: Assuming that the pronoun 'it' refers to the library, and the word 'going' refers to the state of being in your inquiry, then the appropriate response is that the library is unchanged.
Actually, I was just asking how you are feeling and how your day is going...
'How's it going' is actually a colloquial phrase that translates figuratively to 'How is this day of your life progressing so far?' and implies the subtext of 'I hope it is going well.'
The typical response to such a question is 'fine.'
You don't talk much to real people, do you?
If you say so. And I believe you did.
Isn't it wonderful to be cooped up here in this gloomy, stuffy tomb of books instead of outside in the balmy sea breeze?
Hello, sir. How has your day gone so far? I hope things have gone to your liking.
So do you ever get bored sitting here day after day?
Boredom is a state of mind which implies a person is either unimaginative or unintelligent. I am never bored.
Hello, sir. It's another fine day here at Hero-U, don't you think?
Nice weather we're having, isn't it?
More than likely, you are correct.
Hello, Mr. Librarian. It's good to see you again!
I am impressed with your perseverence in absence of encouragement.
Have you had anything stolen from the library by the school thief?
No. The books in this library are secure from thievery.

People are really curious about you and your mysterious past. Are you truly a meek and reclusive curator of this library? Or... are you part of some global conspiracy that seeks to rule the world? Inquiring minds want to know!
No comment. I have no interest in gossip, even when I am the topic.
Have a good night and sweet dreams.
Please refrain from speaking to me as if I were a slightly dim child.
